DataElement.preferredName: Sickle Cell Disease Adult Quality of Life Questionnaire Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A blood disorder characterized by the appearance of sickle-shaped red blood cells and anemia._A human who has reached reproductive age._The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness._Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: An age group comprised of humans who have reached reproductive age.

The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.
